fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Trade, Culture, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Sport, Climate Action, Communication, Migration and asylum
eu_initiatives:
Mainstreaming culture in EU agendas, transnational cooperation in the field of culture and related areas - human and civil rights, development cooperation, sustainability conflict prevention and resolution, cultural trade, equal opportunities, rule of law, freedom of speech, liveable cities and inclusion. 
Formation/consultations of EU external cultural relations policy strategy. EUNIC sees itself as the advocate of an arms-length approach to cultural relations and partnership dialogue for Europe in the world.
organisation_name: European Union National Institutes of Culture (EUNIC)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
Membership of Anna Lindh Foundation 
http://www.annalindhfoundation.org
goals__remit: EUNIC's mission is to act as an advocate of the value of cultural relations in promoting better international understanding.
relevant_communication:
EUNIC works through its over 100 clusters worldwide. 
EUNIC clusters work closely with Permanent representations, embassies and EU Delegations. They see themselves as the link between cultural actors and civil society. EUNIC clusters can develop their own project ideas, our experts are on the ground and have acquired knowledge and contacts over a period of many years of work. As consultants and advisers, they can help EU to convert the EU's goals into concrete cultural cooperation measures.
